sense.name: (The discovery or exhibition of) factual evidence that establishes the truth of something.
sense.examples: Can you offer some proof of these allegations? He made a proof of the philosophical premise.

sense.name: A measure of alcoholic strength.
sense.examples: The proof of the whiskey has yet to be measured. I cannot drink anything of that proof.

sense.name: (printing) and impression made to check for errors.
sense.commentary: Note: also in photographic printing. PROOF[+representation]
sense.examples: We made a proof before the final printing. The proof is sitting on the editor's desk.
